title: Religious diversity in North America in 2010 , by religion
summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Percentage of population for 7 number of Religions.
The Percentage of population is appeared to be the highest at Religion Christians and lowest at Religion Muslims.
The difference of Percentage of population between the highest and lowest Religion is 76.0.
min_summary: This is a bar chart representing Religion in the x axis and Percentage of population in the y axis.
The Percentage of population is appeared to be the highest at Religion Christians and lowest at Religion Muslims.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Percentage of population for 7 number of Religions.
The Percentage of population is appeared to be the highest at Religion Christians and lowest at Religion Muslims.
The difference of Percentage of population between the highest and lowest Religion is 76.0.
max_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Percentage of population for 7 number of Religions.
The Percentage of population is appeared to be the highest at Religion Christians and lowest at Religion Muslims.
Second maximum Percentage of population is found at Religion Unaffiliated.
There is a difference of 76.0 between the maximum Religion Christians and minimum Religion Muslims.
The Religion Christians has the highest Percentage of population, followed by Unaffiliated, and Jews. Down to the Religion Muslims which is the lowest.
Religion Muslims, Other religions, Hindus, and Buddhists share the same value 1.0.
The Religion Christians tends to be 5.39 percent higher than average.
Summing up the values of all Religions, we get total 100.0.
